DEVSWITCHEDON_HINT: Check if the device turned ON
DEVSWITCHEDFF_HINT: Check if the device turned OFF
REPORTT: Returns the temperature reported by the device.
REPORTH: Returns the humidity reported by the device.
REPORTP: Returns the power reported by the device.
SETCELL123: Set cell value,  %1 Row %2 Column %3 Value %4
INCCELL1234: Increment the cell, %1 Row %2 Column %3 Increment %4
GETLASTROWGS: Get the last unused row in the table. This value changes only once - when script runs and then remains unchanged even if you will write something to the row.
ADDSEC12: Add to date, sec. Date: %1 Interval, sec %2
ADDMIN12: Add to date, min. Date: %1 Interval, min %2
ADDHOUR12: Add to date, hours. Date: %1 Interval, hours %2
CLEARRANE12345: Clear range, from %1 row %2 column %3 to row %4 column %5
DOINRANE16: do %1 , from %2 row %3 column %4 to row %5 column %6
TURNONTEMP: Turn ON the device %1 and turn off after  %2 sec
TURNONTEMP_HINT: The device will be turned on and then turned off after the  period of time even if script will finish.  Pay attention that auto-turning off mode will be enabled on the device till the next tun on/off command from the script.
TURNOFFPULSE1_HINT: The pulse mode allows to turn off the device after the period of time after it will be turned ON.
TURNONPULSE12: Turn on pulse mode %1 , the delay is %2 sec
TURNONPULSE12_HINT: The pulse mode allows to turn off the device after the period of time after it will be turned ON.
DOININTERVAL17: Do in the interval from %1 : %2 to %3 : %4 ,  %5 %6 do %7
WEEKSDAYSSET: From %1 : %2 to %3 : %4 , %5 Sun,  %6 Mon, %7 Tue, %8 Wed, %9 Thu, %10 Fri, %11 Sat %12 do %13
LISTEMAILS17: For all unread messages (last day),  %1 from: %2 text in subject: %3 text in body: %4 %5 %6 Mark as read;  %7 delete;
ONLINEOFFLINE: Time passed since the device %1 has become %2 , %3
